page.title: 17Attitudes in Debenham (1).
page.content: The people of Debenham have mixed feelings about village expansion.Many express fears that the new housing will destroy the architectural character and quiet charm of the village.Opinions vary about the quality of the design of the new housing. It is felt that if the village grows too large,the community spirit may be destroyed.There is anxiety that schools and leisure facilities may not expand to keep pace with the influx of population. On the other hand,some people believe that an increase in population is necessary to maintain the existing level of facilities.Many would welcome more information about these. Opinions are divided about the new plastics factory,some considering it inappropriate in a rural area,others welcoming the prospect of more jobs.
